ch.leica.sdk.Devices

Class DeviceManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.leica.sdk.Devices.DeviceManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ch.leica.sdk.connection.BaseConnectionManager.ScanDevicesListener, ErrorListener

    public class DeviceManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements ch.leica.sdk.connection.BaseConnectionManager.ScanDevicesListener, ErrorListener
    This class is used for finding available devices and holding a reference to connected devices.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  DeviceManager.FoundAvailableDeviceListener
      Interface to receive results for available devices.

      • checkBluetoothAvailibilty

        public boolean checkBluetoothAvailibilty()
        Checks if bluetooth is available.
        Returns:
        true if devices can be search over bluetooth

      • checkWifiAvailibilty

        public boolean checkWifiAvailibilty()
        Checks if Wifi is available.
        Returns:
        true if devices can be search over wifi

      • enableBLE

        public void enableBLE()
        Enable the bluetooth adapter

      • findAvailableDevices

        public void findAvailableDevices(android.content.Context context)
                          throws PermissionException
        Starts the finding devices process in background threads. Will search for devices until stopFindingDevices() is called
        Parameters:
        context - android
        Throws:
        PermissionException - app does not have the permissions to access wifi or ble adapters

      • getConnectedDevices

        public java.util.List<Device> getConnectedDevices()
        Retrieve a list of all connected devices.
        Returns:
        a copy of the list of the currently connected devices

      • getErrorListener

        public ErrorListener getErrorListener()
        get listener to notify that an error has been found
        Returns:
        Error Listener

      • getInstance

        public static DeviceManager getInstance(android.content.Context context)
        Obtain an instance of the device Manager
        Parameters:
        context - the applications context
        Returns:
        the instance of the DeviceManager

      • registerReceivers

        public void registerReceivers(android.content.Context context)
        This call registers broadcast receivers for changes of wifi and bluetooth adapters. Do not forget to unregister.
        Parameters:
        context - the applications context

      • setErrorListener

        public void setErrorListener(ErrorListener errorListener)
        Sets the listener for occurring errors.
        Parameters:
        errorListener - the object which gets called when an error occurs within DeviceManager

      • setFoundAvailableDeviceListener

        public void setFoundAvailableDeviceListener(DeviceManager.FoundAvailableDeviceListener foundAvailableDeviceListener)
        Sets the listener for found devices
        Parameters:
        foundAvailableDeviceListener - the object which gets called when a device is found

      • stopFindingDevices

        public void stopFindingDevices()
        Stops the finding device process.

      • unregisterReceivers

        public void unregisterReceivers()
        This call unregisters broadcast receivers for changes of wifi and bluetooth adapters

      • checkGPSAvailability

        public boolean checkGPSAvailability()
        Checks if GPS is available.
        Returns:
        true if GPS is available

      • enableWifi

        public void enableWifi()
        Enable the wifi adapter

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Because DeviceManager is a singleton, it can happen, that the receivers were unregistered and acl disconnect receiver does not get the call. this happens, when the activity gets relaunched, when the ble device is connected automatically. this method is for not saving the acl object for ever
